}} 'Theodosius Grygorovych Dobzhansky' ForMemRS (; January 24, 1900 -
December 18, 1975) was a prominent geneticist and evolutionary biologist, and a
central figure in the field of evolutionary biology for his work in shaping the
unifying modern evolutionary synthesis. Dobzhansky was born in
Ukraine (then part of Imperial Russia) and emigrated to the United States as a
young man in 1927.

He published a major work of the modern evolutionary synthesis, the synthesis of
evolutionary biology with genetics, in 1937.

He was awarded the National Medal of Science in
1964, [http://www.nsf.gov/od/nms/recip_details.cfm?recip_id=107 National
Science Foundation - The President's National Medal of Science] and the
Franklin Medal in 1973.
